alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 9:04PM EST until December 20 at 5:52AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. East Branch Penobscot River At Grindstone affecting Penobscot County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...East Branch Penobscot River at Grindstone. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, State Route 11 flooded in places. Homes and camps threatened. Significant flooding of Penobscot River Trails. Moderate backwater flooding of Mud & Hay Brooks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.8 feet. - River is out of its banks. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Tuesday was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 8.4 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 03/20/1936. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 315 AM EST.
